Reviews.Title: +$900 Performance in a $500 shell.  +$60 to unlock its Full potential, (thumbs up)Doc Techguy
Reviews.Author: GC
Reviews.Content: <><>EXPECTED PERFORMANCE METER<><><Entertainment>[Average] PC Gaming or [Excellent] Facebook Gaming[Excellent] Social Media surfing (Twitter,Facebook,Linkedin)[Excellent] Video Chatting (Skype)[Excellent] Streaming Shows HD (Netlfix,Youtube,Hulu,iTunes)[Excellent] Music Library (iTunes,Amazon MP3,Lastfm,Spotify)[Excellent] MS Office Suite[Excellent] TurboTax, Quickbooks[Excellent] Education Free Courses (from basic algetbra at Udacity to advance MIT's Open Courseware)<Express Your Creativity>[Excellent]Creation (create music recordings, Audacity)[Excellent] Photoshop editing (Photoshop Elements)[Excellent] Video Editing (Sony Vegas/MovieStudio, Adobe Premier)[Excellent] Website development (Adobe Dreamweaver CS3)<> PROS: SOLD by Amazon. an Intel i5 touchscreen at 14" for under $800 is rare. Way under priced for the potential this can deliver after you upgrade it to 8 GB.  Could easily be marked up  close to +$900 for sure after Ram upgrade. Battery life is really good(+6.25hrs), even with all that processing power due to (new)Haswell processor architecture.Skype will not be a blurry mess  because of HD Webcam.Playing pc games beyond the casual Facebook apps is possibleVery few 14" portables still has Optical Dvd Drives, this does.[CPU Passmark Score: 3346]This CPU score is incredible in this sub $500 category.  To give some comparisons in score related to price points.CPU Passmark Score: 900 = $299 11"notebooksCPU Passmark Score: 1700 = $399 14" notebooksCPU Passmark Score: 2400 = $+500 15" notebooksNow to unlock its full potential, you just need to upgrade the ram from 4GB to 8GB.Its easy.  If you are the type of person who can  drive from point A to point B using by fallowing instructions on Navigation GPS then upgrading is  a simple 3 step process.get something like thisA-DATA Premier Pro Series 8 GB Single DDR3 1600Mhz CL11 SODIMM Laptop Memory AD3S1600W8G11-RA-DATA Premier Pro Series 8 GB Single DDR3 1600Mhz CL11 SODIMM Laptop Memory  AD3S1600W8G11-R<><>CONS: 4GB is bottlenecking the class leading CPU onboard.  Not Windows 8.1  would have been nice to have Windows 8.1 out of the box.  Although upgrading Win8 to 8.1 through the Microsoft Market Place is simple (I got tips for upgrading, read below).Ideally forStudentsBusiness Travelersor just about anyone who wants an easy to handle and portable notebook on the go but still relies on powerful hardware that can handle anything thrown at it.<><>==Windows 8.1 Tips & Computing Safety==<><>Bring back the start button: Installing one of these two software will help new Windows8.1 users to ease into "Modern" user interface of windows 8.11) Classic Shell (free) or 2) Start8 (Stardock $5)___________________________________________________________________Avoiding major damages caused by those pesky malware,virus etc by simply not using an "Administrator Account" with your main MS Account.Viruses will likely cause more damage and will be impossible to completely remove if they gained Admisitrator's right and  have dug deep inside your computer.  An "Administrators" account is a backdoor route viruses/malware uses get in and cause unrecoverable distruction to your data. With Admin rights those malware can easily infect deep within your "recovery partitions'! meaning, these's not turning back and you're royally screwed. Theres many more problems that can happen but I think you already get my point.GOALS: 1) Don't use your Main MS Account as an" Adminitrator" but instead "standard"  2) Create a secondary account called "local account" and set that up as the Administrator instead.Account Management: steps creating a local account(administrator) and MS Account(standard)Charms search: type"control panel" > "User's Accounts and Family Safety" > "Remove User account" > " Add a new user in PC settings " located at bottom of window > Bringing you to Metro > click "add Account" > "Sign in without MS accout" located at bottom of page > "Local Accout" > create new user name and PWYou have 2 options on Signing IN1) Microsoft account or 2) Local Account1) Create or sign in with your MAIN Microsoft Account. If you already an MS account or uses windows phones/ xbox live or Hotmail/live/MSN email address you can use these as well to link those services to 1 master MS Account.2) Create a Local Account. Thise secondary account will not connect to MS's ecosytem but only in your local computer. I identical to USERS login on Windows 7,Vista,XP etc.Once you've setup these two accounts, you must set each account type to: >Change ACCOUNT TYPE for Main MS Account to "Standard"Change ACCOUNT TYPE for 2ndary Local Account to "Administrator"Please do these steps, it only takes 5minutes.  Its a small price to pay considering, it may  potentially rescue your entire data from a completely erasing your data after sending it for repairs.__________________________________________________________________________Making Back ups/ EtcAnother tip is to make a recovery image.First install Setup all your programs , setup your custom settings, etcAfter personalizing your PC.  > Its time to Create a Recovery Image right after you've set everything up.  This image will allow you to revert back to this pc's state in time, and in perfect working order.Sometimes system recovery doesn't solve your problems so having secondary backup plan like Recovery Image is key.________________________________________________________________________Not optional, must practice these 3 regular computing habits.#1  (Install McAfee Antivirus, which is now free starting 2014, per Intel's 2014 Keynote at CES) or Paid programs such as Kaspersky Internet Security 2014  is the leading software in the market today. $50.  These programs scans your system automatically, so set it and forget it.#2  (Install MalwareBytes/free, scan your pc every month with this program or sooner when you feel like your system is sluggish or seeing webpages poping up that you didnt click)  Because this is a free software, as a user you must manually start the scaning process or by buying retail version you'll unlock the auto scan scheduler feature.#3  (Install Superantispyware/free, Scan pc every 2wks)Because this is a free software, as a user you must manually start the scaning process or by buying retail version you'll unlock the auto scan scheduler feature.Its ok skip a few scans between months, although not advisable, especially if your a heavy web surfing maniac spending 2-3 hrs daily websurfing not just facebooking.  But please dont go without using all 3 programs more than 5-8 Months in between scans.________________________________________________________________________Another way to avoid  spreading your personal information out there into the wild unknowingly is to un-google yourself.yes ladies and gents! google or yahoo especially yahoo LOL..... but google is key here.Microsoft sells Primarily Software.Apple sells Primarily HardwareGoogle sells neither, that's why their products are so CHEAP, once they suckered in their backdoor ridden ecosystem, Google Inc. sells Primarily Everything about YOU!_____________________________________________________________________________________________________Steps in upgrading from Windows 8 to Windows 8.1  (2-3hrs)Key here is to ensure your windows 8 is fully updated before upgrading to win8.1Therefore repeatedly "check of updates" on windowsHow to upgrade to windows 8.1 for dummies.Step 1: Go to Metro and not desktopStep 2: Start typing : "Control Panel"Step 3: Click "Windows Update" > "Check for Update"Step 4: install updatesStep 5: restart computerStep 6: Repeat step 1 -5 until result "no more updates"Step 7: Run HP Update client, install all updates from HP to ensure all drivers and bugfixes are updated.( or whichever OEM you may have, lenovo,dell, sony etc.)Step 8: Uninstall your Antivirus Software (important) then RESTART PCStep 9: Go to Windows Store and upgrade to 8.1Step 10: leave computer on for 2hrs as it upgrades.Step 11: Repeat Steps 1 - 7Step 12: if you're not a complete fool, 8.1 upgrade should be straight forward. \After steps 1-8 ONLY THEN you should install WIndows 8.1 at the marketplace. Goodluck.(note: steps above removes a lot of failures users experience after 8.1 update)___________________________________________________________Not many want to shell out their dollars on Office 360  if all they intend of using is standard word processors.you can use a free web version of office calledBing.com search:  "MS Office Web Apps"just sign in with the same  MS Account user name used on your PC.

Reviews.Title: Great price and fast laptop
Reviews.Author: Willy Henry Chaves Sánchez
Reviews.Content: Great price and product, fast, and I highly recommend it. Excelent good tactil screen. It was powerful enough to do all of the tasks he needed on the internet, word processing, etc..

Reviews.Title: Met my requirements
Reviews.Author: Girlgadget
Reviews.Content: Very fast. I purchased this as a xmas gift. I played with it for a while, and I really liked it. The size was perfect,and  it does have a replaceable battery.

Reviews.Title: Overall
Reviews.Author: Jroman
Reviews.Content: well first of all when amazon gives you the option of free shipping it means you place the order then wait for a week to be marked as shipped and then another week to be delivered, so if your one of the impatient type I suggest you pay the 17$ they ask you for express shipping! overall when the computer came I thought the 14inch would be a little too small since I prefer big displays but upon arrival the screen size is just perfect what I wanted. it looks waay better then the 17in and 15in screens. The computer is pretty light, it works great too. if your looking for a performance laptop at an affordable price get this one! for running on intel 15 with 2.6ghz turboboost its at a fantastic price! a lapto of this performance at bestbuy or any electronic store expect to pay 700$+ tax. the color option they give you(silver) is great it looks god on a laptop.the computer is fast it gives you Norton security free antivirus software for 2 months. the parts don't look that cheaply made as for one of the reviews! just handle with care and maintain your laptop responsibly and it should last you long enough!dont be scared to buy! if arrived in damaged condition from the carrier call amazon and their friendly enough to refund/replace for free. shipping included. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: My first HP laptop
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to test this brand. It came with Windows 8. I did not like the start up screen so I downloaded the startup for 8.1 and that worked better. The touch screen function is nice, with everything touch these days...it's handy. The right and left click mouse buttons are too hard and the keys are too soft. There is no backlight for the keyboard. It came pre-loaded with so many apps that it works slow...slow on start up and opening and saving etc. And the screen froze a few times already. I'm trying to delete most of them to see if the laptop would work faster. Might update this review later if I really get to like this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Bad
Reviews.Author: mohamed nabil
Reviews.Content: It is the worst Laptop I have ever seen. Hanging a lot and now it is day 42 from the purchase date  and most of the keyboard keys stop working at all. Do not waste your time and money with HP

Reviews.Title: compact size; loads quickly; has optical drive.
Reviews.Author: WOODDUCKER41
Reviews.Content: lacks backlighting on special keys, doesn't have fax modem, had some initial difficulty making connection with network and internet, literature could be more descriptive of features and how to access memory bay.Being familiar with XP,  Windows 8 is a nightmare, extremely user unfriendly.  Like the computer, so far has run very well.

Reviews.Title: fooled by Amazon but product is good
Reviews.Author: nimish rustagi
Reviews.Content: The product is quite nice, the specifications are very good and the touch screen is very responsive too. However I checked the warranty and though it said 1 year in the specifications it's only 6 months when I checked on HP website.... I guess that's a big let down. Since I am in France now I can't really get this sorted with the Amazon us where I bought it.

Reviews.Title: For the Price a Great Computer with a few Flaws!
Reviews.Author: Michael Brezler "Dart Enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: The Good... Touch screen, DVD drive, lightweight, Core I5 processor, 4 gigs ramThe Bad... The plug that goes into the computer is at a right angle and tends to pop out, or I don't realize that it isn't plugged in and when I go to use the computer the battery is dead.  I then need it plugged in and I lose the versatility.  All my other HP laptops had a straight plug and I never had this problem before.The Ugly... Windows 8 is a horrible operating system.  They should have kept Windows 7 and just added the touch screen.Overall other than the plug it's a great laptop!

Reviews.Title: Brand new system/lots of problems already
Reviews.Author: Dayanara Figueroa "Dee"
Reviews.Content: I did my research prior to getting this laptop. The main reason why I bought it was that it has a dvd player and good battery life. I was looking for a decent system, lightweight and with media capabilities to travel with and this one had good rates so I went ahead and bought it. To my disappointment, I'm unable to watch/listen any video. Video and audio skips weather you are using the power cable or it is operating purely off of the battery and I looked for a fix/upgrades and tried some stuff with no success. Another thing it started doing on it's own is disabling the wifi adapter so my wifi connection keeps dropping and it is not due to wifi being down :(. I have to go and manually enable the adapter to get it to recognize the available wifi's and reconnect which is not cool. And ...of course you need to pay a service fee if you want to service it by HP customer support, so all in all not impressed at all....I have a dell system that is over 10 years old that is not this problematic :(.

Reviews.Title: A bit more than what I need but I love it
Reviews.Author: Vernon Aliga
Reviews.Content: First off, my buying factors in the laptop were performance, size, portability, and design.PROS:In terms of performance, it's a great laptop and I deliberately got the Core i5 4th generation processor.  My previous laptop was just dying because it couldn't handle the workload anymore and so far this has been great despite what I'm running on it.  Size is a little bit bigger than expected and the weight matches my expectations.  Design-wise, I like how the keyboard is very quiet and how easy it is to type and manage the track pad.  Touch screen is something that I wasn't necessarily looking for, but based on the 1-2 times I've ever touched the screen, it does seem responsive.CONS:Windows 8.  Seriously I've had this for weeks and I have not been able to make good use of the OS.  I can't bring it to Windows 7, which sucks.  Also, the touch screen seems to add a few inches to the sides.  So the frame is about half an inch on each side, and then there's an extra quarter inch per side before the actual visible part of the desktop shows up.  Kind of hard to describe.OVERALLGreat laptop overall and it has a few more features than what I need.  In the end though, with the rate that laptops are being churned out, it's highly likely that a cheaper laptop without the extra fluff that I didn't need would eventually come out.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Momster
Reviews.Content: I think this computer is great!  We had only smart phones for a few years and I love the way that windows 8 uses an app format, and the touch screen is good, too.  It's lightweight, good quality picture and webcam.  The only thing I was a little disappointed about was the fact that it didn't have Microsoft word on it, but that is my fault for not reading the fine print clearly. It cost me 140 to download.

Reviews.Title: it's a great laptop
Reviews.Author: Ana Diaz
Reviews.Content: it's a great laptop. I really liked it, Great price and product, and it have a good battery life. it's works perfectly so far.

Reviews.Title: Looking for a used Mac.
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Bluetooth did not work. Returned for refund. Difficult to set up. I really don't like windows 8. Looking for a used Mac.

Reviews.Title: computer great, windows 8 sucks!
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: Computer fine, but new windows program is way different than any others. Seems more of a phone type os than pc. Big learning curve annoying.

Reviews.Title: Heavy,crashes often
Reviews.Author: sam Awotwi
Reviews.Content: Laptop looked good on sleek on the website but really heavy and once I received it. It crashes often and the grating on the touch pad area is annoying. Would return it if I had the box and had not put so much of my data on it.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this laptop
Reviews.Author: Executive
Reviews.Content: The value of this laptop is on par with the quality and performance of the device. I looked at more expensive models but I can say that thus far the HP Pavilion has been great. The touch screen has a high resolution and it does not bother my eyes. It has all the standard features and so far I have not been disappointed by Windows 8. I can recommend this laptop to anyone wanting to use it for the home, or business traveling. The cosmetic appearance is beautiful as well.

Reviews.Title: Great value computer
Reviews.Author: Eric Paulus
Reviews.Content: Quality computer for the price. Light-weight and thin, sleek appearance. Good battery life. DVD drive nice to have. Windows 8 isn't bad, it just takes a few days to get used to it. The touch screen is nice - between touch screen, touchpad, and wireless mouse, it is nice to have 3 different ways to navigate the computer. Only disadvantage at this point (1 month after purchase) is the computer seems kinda slow at times, when transitioning between applications. I realize the processor isn't the best out there, but I run few/simple applications and didn't expect to notice these occasional minor delays so quickly. Not a huge deal, and definitely worth it for the overall value of the computer at this price. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Awesome computer!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This computer is worth way more than what i payed for it, i love that i can use either touch screen or keyboard!!

Reviews.Title: This is great
Reviews.Author: Boa Jon mo
Reviews.Content: The Product arrive in a timely manner, its fully functional, and it does everything i need it to. The only issue I've had with it is that sometimes the touch will get messed up and it will shrink or enlarge my web browser like on a phone. Of course I know Windows 8 is meant for a phone but thats really the only annoying thing with the screen sensitivity.

Reviews.Title: Average at best
Reviews.Author: Ugo Cirignano
Reviews.Content: The screen quality is poor. Performance is OK. Works well if your company is cloud based and there is not much for this Laptop to process.

Reviews.Title: Safety assured.
Reviews.Author: Lucille I Edwards
Reviews.Content: I love this because of the touch-screen features, and because it's loads quickly. I don't have to look for updates, the updates are always there waiting to be downloaded, making me feel secure knowing that this laptop is always looking out for my safety and privacy, but I really need this  for when I'm traveling, since I have a desktop at home, since this laptop has only 500gb I have to be careful not to overwhelm it, I have downloaded my top rated movies to watch and also my music library when on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop.
Reviews.Author: jnk
Reviews.Content: This HP is just right for what my wife and I use it for.  Small, light, efficient, fast.  Touchscreen functions are excellent.  Keyboard is just right for the size.  Display is excellent.  Windows 8 takes some getting used to, but after you do it is clearly a superior operating system, at least to me.  HP pre-loaded software is good - system updates are a breeze.  No real negatives.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth The Money, But Not A Bad Laptop
Reviews.Author: The Oblong Box
Reviews.Content: Pros-HP Coolsense (It's amazing. The laptop stays cool. For someone who uses their computer a lot, this is an amazing feature.)-Lightweight (Computer is very light and portable)-Appearance (It's a beautiful machine)-CD/DVD DriveCons-Battery Life Lie (It actually only has a battery life of 5.5 hours, not 6.25 hours. This is not a bad battery life. I just don't appreciate being lied to.)-Touch Pad Sucks (It is a touch screen laptop and that may be why the touch pad doesn't work as well as a regular laptop.)-Sound (It's not bad, but it's not that great either. I'm not a huge fan of DTS sound.)-Internet Issues (I don't want to blame HP for this. It could very well be an issue with Windows 8.)Overall, I feel like this laptop is a little bit expensive because it really doesn't bring all that much to the table. It's still a good laptop, but you could probably find a laptop that is just as good for a lesser price.

Reviews.Title: Great... as long as it's actually working.
Reviews.Author: Lori Wagner
Reviews.Content: I loved it when I got it.... three weeks ago. The touch screen is great, it's pretty fast, and it just a generally great computer. But then about two weeks after I got it, it was already reading for disk errors and having to repair itself. Then this morning (a week later) the hard drive failed. HP tech support was going to have me mail it to them so they could replace the hard drive. Needless to say, I'm just returning the laptop and replacing it. Hopefully this time it will work for more than a month.

Reviews.Title: My new computer
Reviews.Author: Walt Herriott
Reviews.Content: After taking some time to understand the procedures, everything is pretty good.  Without instructions, I had to hunt and peck my way through the programs and operating procedures.  After that, the screen is sharp, handles touch directions well and I'm overall well satisfied.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON AND HP ARE BOTH AMAZING COMPANIES
Reviews.Author: RUTH N.
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Laptop after I put in timely and careful research to make sure I bought the right one for me. This laptop had all of the necessary apps to meet my every need. In my situation which was very rare and isolated I came upon a glitch which HP had shown their sensitivity to and took very seriously to ensure that my "customer experience and satisfaction" was nothing short of excellent!  Amazon and HP care about their customers and it has been proven to me. Amazon is sending me a new laptop. I will say that this touchscreen laptop DOES have many wonderful features. I requested to receive a replacement of the same make and model because it is a great computer. I could have request any other brand name and model but why? this is the one I want. I was also given the choice of being reimbursed but why? This is the one! I am looking forward in resuming  my experience with this laptop model  My situation (please realize) was such an oddity and a rare occurrence, that both HP and Amazon are both amazing companies proven to me that they DO care about their customer satisfaction (which in this day and time is impossible to find).  Thank you HP and Amazon for making this process so easy and your continued support of saying "do not worry, we will take care of everything. And they did. I highly recommend this laptop solely based on the companies that support their products!I will review the Laptop once I receive it. But I can say that this is HP at it's best as far as options to utilize. I wanted this laptop as a replacement

Reviews.Title: Great product! Great value!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Fields
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for her first year of college. Does everything she needs it to and more.Very happy with it!Would recommend this computer to anyone in school or heading off to school.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Laptop For Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: JLVB
Reviews.Content: I've has this laptop for a week and works great.  I needed a small laptop for work even though I have a PC and an ipad.  Seems fast and I love the touchscreen.,  It also has airprint with I've gotten so used to with my iphone and ipad.  I can print documents and contracts from my porch swing!.

Reviews.Title: Having some problems
Reviews.Author: Michael L McKinney
Reviews.Content: I think maybe it has hard drive issues. It runs hot and shuts down suddenly. I would like to exchange for another unit.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: MARY D
Reviews.Content: This laptop it's so cute sleek beautiful and Light weight very easy to work with and the touchscreen is awesome I will definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: excellent machine and good value
Reviews.Author: Amy Tidwell
Reviews.Content: I needed a smaller laptop than the 17" I use as my main computer and spent a lot of time researching what was available. This laptop had everything I wanted and nothing I didn't need. My only hesitation was the price--I thought it too low for what I was getting. Based on reviews, I upgraded to 8gb RAM and replaced the OS with Ubuntu (I don't like Windows 8), and now have a machine that I love. Since I do mostly word processing, I can't really comment on screen resolution--it is great for my needs--or sound (I turn the sound off). I love the feel of the keyboard and the size is perfect for sliding into my work tote, however, it is a bit heavier than I was expecting, but not objectionably so.Delivery was super fast, with everything arriving a day earlier than expected, and the contents were well packaged.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Anne
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical at first about this laptop. Although I had read the  so many good reviews I was still  worried until it actually arrive and I saw it in real . It look ed well produce. At a closer look you can see that it's' not expensive looking plastic but overall looks great. The laptop felt really light until the battery went on, it become a it heavy but still light and thine as advertised. The touchscreen works wonderfully, the touchpad still getting use to it, the sensors to me may not be as strong as it needs to be.  The screen is bright and nice at first I did not like the black broader on the screen so the Windows can fit a 14inch screen. But I got used to it and now I don't even  recognise it.  Windows 8 and 8.1 work great love it. So overall this laptop is a great product for this price , I recommend it for all and those who are on a budget and want  a well performing laptop. This is it. Grantee .  Let's just hope Amazon don't rise the price.

Reviews.Title: Fine little laptop.
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Hayes
Reviews.Content: I like the laptop alot. Nice size. Glad it has an optical drive. Hate the windows 8 and 8.1. Good price.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Choppy
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for 2 weeks, and so far I really like it.  Looks better than than the advertised picture--sleek and light.  Keeps cool and I can barely hear the fan.  Battery life is good, but I don't think it's quite as long as 6.25 hours.Windows 8 isn't as user-unfriendly as I feared; I upgraded to 8.1 right away and got rid of most of the bloatware.  The touchscreen definitely helps and is sensitive enough.  My one wish is that the keyboard were backlit, but overall a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: My laptop purchase and delivery
Reviews.Author: darus hunter
Reviews.Content: The item arrived in a timely fashion. It's a great buy and meets all of my computer needs. The only problem I had was with the shipping specifics. The item was marked "If not home leave outside". I did not nor would I ever request such an absurd option. I have no idea where that decision was made but it was not a well-thought decision.

Reviews.Title: Expect to replace flimsy parts. Build quality is poor.
Reviews.Author: Sky Guy "Sky Guy"
Reviews.Content: I had the previous version of Pavilion 14 inch and let me tell you. The build quality is so poor. The hinges are weak plastic and within a few months the screen cracked and the weak plastic hinges bent and broke. This is with reasonable wear.I guess with HP Pavilions you get a cheaper price and cheaper parts.  Expect to replace it within a year or so.Also their tech service is terrible. They kind of blame the user for any thing that breaks and youll expect to be on the phone for 5 hours with a guy named Anish from India.  They really take forever to replace something at HP and their quailty is terrible.I only gave it 2 stars because of the price.
